answerText: The Tale of Genji [or Genji monogatari][10] The author of The Tale of Genji used this pen name both for herself and for the niece of Lady Fujitsubo in the novel.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Louisville Round 11 | 6 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This novel implies one character's death with the blank chapter "Vanished into the Clouds," while in its second chapter, men discuss members of the opposite sex in the "Appraisal of Women on a Rainy Night" scene. For 10 points each. [10] Name this novel whose later Uji chapters focus on the main character's grandson Niou and great-nephew Kaoru.
